posts.title: Did You Know - Merino Sheep
posts.body: Back in 2004, Shrek the Merino sheep hid in a cave for six years so he wouldn’t have to get sheared. But the time he was cornered and given his long-overdue haircut on New Zealand national television, there was enough wool to make 20 mens suits. In 2015, a sheep named Chris who was found in Canberra, Australia, unloaded 89-pounds of fleece. Unlike wild sheep or “hair sheep,” (breeds that naturally shed), the wool of domestic breeds like the Merino will just keep growing, according to Dave Thomas, the now retired head of sheep studies at the University of Wisconsin, Madison.

comments.message: Intresting. I would like to know how much they made after selling the fleece
time he was cornered and given his long-overdue haircut on New Zealand national television, there was enough wool to make 20 mens suits

posts.title: Treatment for Fleas
posts.body: Hello, kindly recommend the best treatment for fleas. They've invaded my chicken and goats. Bought delete and sprayed, it didnt kill all. ( There was once an outbreak and this did wonders but this time it  didnt) Doom powder poured all over....nothing... Paraffin + water spray....nothing Triatix spray....nothing What else can I use kindly? Note I noticed the neighbors dogs were the source, bought delete and doom powder for him to spray. But noticed last weekend they still had the fleas He claimed other stray dogs were the source.
